New Records: Freddie Freeman hit the first game-ending grand slam in World Series history
Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman's game-winning grand slam in the 10th inning
Giancarlo Stanton's two-run homer for New York
Tommy Edman's diving stop and throw to second base that prevented a run
Pre-Game Insights: The match was highly anticipated due to the star-studded rosters of both teams
Post-Match Reflections: Freddie Freeman expressed his joy and gratitude towards his father
Aaron Judge expressed disappointment but emphasized the need to learn from the loss and focus on the next game
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the 12th time the Yankees and Dodgers have met in the World Series, the most frequent matchup in major league annals
Others: The game was played at Dodger Stadium in Los Angeles
The first Series with a pair of 50-home run hitters in Judge (58) and Ohtani (54)
